        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • NutchServer

        public NutchServer()
        Public constructor which accepts the port we wish to run the server on as well as the logging granularity. If the latter option is not provided via main(String[]) then it defaults to 'INFO' however best attempts should always be made to specify a logging level.

    • Method Detail

      • getClasses

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Convenience method to determine whether a Nutch server is running.
        Returns:
        true if a server instance is running.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the Nutch server printing some logging to the log file.

      • canStop

        public boolean canStop(boolean force)
        Safety and convenience method to determine whether or not it is safe to shut down the server. We make this assertion by consulting the org.apache.nutch.api.NutchApp#jobManager for a list of jobs with JobInfo.state equal to 'RUNNING'.
        Parameters:
        force - ignore running tasks
        Returns:
        true if there are no jobs running or false if there are jobs with running state.

      • stop

        public boolean stop(boolean force)
        Stop the Nutch server.
        Parameters:
        force - boolean method to effectively kill jobs regardless of state.
        Returns:
        true if no server is running or if the shutdown was successful. Return false if there are running jobs and the force switch has not been activated.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Exception
        Throws:
        Exception
